story.text: CARACAS At least 16 prisoners died and 13 were wounded when rival gangs fought for control of one of Venezuela's notoriously overcrowded and violent jails, an official said on Tuesday."We have the situation under control now," Fanny Marquez, prison-system chief at the Interior Ministry, told state television, saying the clash at Uribana prison in the western state of Lara had broken out at dawn on Monday.Riots, murders and clan warfare are common in Venezuela's prisons where many inmates wait for months before getting to court. The government has pledged to reform jails.
story.title: venezuelan prisoners fight to control jail , 16 dead
